items.title: Extreme Weather Leaves Incarcerated People at Risk When Temps Plunge
items.description: The Marshall Project heard reports of scarce food and water and interrupted access to medical care during a day-long power outage at one prison.

items.title: ‘Why Is This Happening to Us?’ Daily Number of Kids in ICE Detention Jumps 6x Under Trump
items.description: As the Trump administration detains large numbers of kids, advocates worry ‘it’s only a matter of time before we see a child die.’

items.title: Echoes of Isolation
items.description: A 2013 prison hunger strike in California led to a dramatic decline in the use of solitary confinement. More than a decade later, people impacted by s...

items.title: A Diverse Boomtown in Trump Country Says ‘Thanks, But No Thanks’ to ICE
items.description: In Springdale, Arkansas, immigrants drive growth. Local leaders worry cooperating with federal immigration raids endangers community trust.

items.title: From JFK to Trump: How the Insurrection Act Shifted from Civil Rights to Political Combat
items.description: The military has been used domestically about 30 times since 1807, mostly to enforce civil rights and quell riots. Can they be used to quash political...
